result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DNA surcharge, Court costs and victim witness surcharges are to be paid by 11/16/2018.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No contact with R.J.B., her family, house, school or work.  Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.

Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
Sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Register with the Sex Offender Registry.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Devon Gibbs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (71 pages) commencing 11/6/15 received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet
11/16/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm and Paul Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 28 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
 IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
 (as to probation)
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact with RJB, her family, house, school or work. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 11/16/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 11/16/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero
-Sex Offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
*Defendant to Register with the Sex Offender Registry
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Filed, Victim Impact Statement

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Both parties have requested a plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 15 on November 30, 2015 at 9:00am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  All previsously stated terms and conditions remain same.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 10/5/2015.
filed along with State's Requested Jury Instructions and State's Motion in Limine. sab
Justice Point Reort received and filed. sab

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 10/13/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 11/30/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense just received report from psychologist and needs additional time to review with defendant.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502SB. Case is set for projected plea.
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Bihler is in trial in Branch 26 and unable to appear today.  Clerk contacted Branch 26 and spoke with counsel and set a new plea date of 7-21-2015.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a motion hearing. Defense still awaiting medical records regarding psychological evaluation. Defense counsel has determined no issue with Miranda Rights and defendant waives the hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense request for a motion hearing date / final pretrial date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 38  Motion hearing scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 08:15 am.

15RM022923  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/01/2015

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: RJB (dob: 10/14/1999).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Reginald Devon Gibbs in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
